intro: Ctenodon laca-buendianus, commonly known as the Bontoc fern, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the Polypodiaceae family, which includes various types of ferns and mosses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. It thrives in cool, moist environments, typically in shaded forest areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
